reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. Rooms are big, even the smallest room types, very comfortable bedding and fair enough breakfast with real eggs!
reviews.title: Great Value!

reviews.text: I would recommend Timbers hotel to anyone for any purpose. Congrats to this chic Scandinavian style hotel.
reviews.title: Good staff- coordination lacking in services

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were here for a meeting at the Medical Center, so location was excellent. On check in staff placed us in a room that was not cleaned yet, so my husband had to trek downstrs for another room card. Very pleasant work out room had two eliptical trainers that did not have functioning displays, though they worked fine if you watched the clock. One person tried hard to fix this and a manager finally told me that a battery charger was missing and that they would try to get it fixed. Hotel very attractively decorated - had Mitchell Gold chairs in the very clean king bedded room in which we stayed.. On a Saturday, the lobby was taken over with special events in the am. Attached Peoria restaurant was fine and service was attentive. Transportation to nearby Macy's at Stapleton Mall was excellent. Major positive was staff who wanted to do a good job, but didn't seem coordinated. for some reason.
reviews.title: Never Again

reviews.text: Never again would I stay at this Hotel. It was the worst experience . The front desk person Patty did not even know how to direct us to our room she sent us to the farthest elevator in the wrong direction . After being sent in the wrong direction we went all the way around the hotel. It was 99 degree's in Denver today and the Air conditioning was not turned on the second level so it was about 100 degree's on the second floor wandering almost passing out we finally located our room which was 15 steps off the elevator by the front desk??? When I asked Patty why she sent us that way she said "Oh I do not know this hotel very well???? Entering our room to find the ac unit was turned off. We arrived at 7 and check in is after 3 no one turned the ac on in our room for our arrival our room was 93 degrees? The ac is still struggling freezing up every so often it is 80 degrees 3 hours later. We were not offered a remedy for this situation they stopped answering the front desk phone. We secured the room on Hotels . com and Frances from Hotels . com called and spoke to Patty then came back on the line with me trying to remedy the situation then went back to speak to Patty and Patty is no longer answering her calls??? . The customer service ???What is up? Do your self a BIG favor stay at any other place but this one.
reviews.title: We Loved It!!

reviews.text: We vacationed with our daughter & her husband and wanted something for just one night after the Rockies game, that could provide a little privacy if needed, and were thrilled with this place. With The separate living/tv area it was perfect. Everything was so clean, & so pretty. Our response when we walked into the lobby was "WOW". We all just wished we had gotten to stay longer. It was very easy to access from the interstate coming in from the east, as we also went to the Coors Brewery then back to our room to rest before the baseball game. Perfect!
reviews.title: Nothing Suite

reviews.text: This is a suite hotel, just off I-70, with 24 hour shuttle service to Denver Airport. It is very comfortable with a homey southwestern motif, very clean rooms, and very pleasant staff. The restaurant, Peoria Grill, had some of the best food I ever had, especially the ribs. It also has free WiFi in the rooms and a 24 hour fitness room with state-of-the art equipment.
reviews.title: Comfortable, Clean, Convenient

reviews.text: I stay here often when I am in Denver for either business or pleasure, and am flying out or flying in. If you have an early morning flight, this is a great place to stay the night before. Plenty to do within a short drive (Northfield Stapleton area is a couple miles away with lots of shopping and dining), and still relatively close to the airport . I will be back again next month.
reviews.title: Keep coming back...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds are very plush and comfortable, the rooms are large and clean. The staff has always been pleasant.
reviews.title: Nice, Pleasant, Unremarkable...

reviews.text: Picked this hotel for a day stayover in Denver because it looked more "interesting" than the other chain hotels in the airport area. Booked through CheapHotels.Com about a month in advance.
reviews.title: Good Value but no bathtubs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice, clean, pleasant and totally unremarkable... The room was spacious and had high ceilings, bed was comfortable, small fridge and micro in the room. Small private patio opened into a courtyard. NO BATHTUB, but a nice, oversized shower.
reviews.title: Don't stay here!

reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights. After a late arriving we checked in to our room, (studio type) The room was a nice size with a small "kitchen area"with a microwave oven and a small refrigerator. The next morning when we wanted to use the toilet and the shower we discovered the sliding room between the bathroom and bedroom could not be closed as it was stuck in the wall. We reported this to the frontdesk when we went down for breakfast. We were told the guy who does the repair was not in and would not come in before the next day (saturday). We explained that we really did not like the current situation with the sliding door as this obviously created privacy problems as well as "smelly problems"when somebody uses the toilet !! The lady at the front desk replied that we just had to wait until the next day unless housekeeping could solve the problem (which they could not as it appears). We complained the next two following days but were told the guy did not appear on Saturday or Sunday. When we checked out on monday as complained ones more we were faced with the same uninterested reply that they were sorry for the inconvenience but there was nothing they could do about this. (Maybe they could have offered us another room when we complained the first time???)
reviews.title: Nice room but staff needs some training about service

reviews.text: So much for service for this hotel, there is work to be done by the hotel management when it comes to training there staff about service to the guests!
reviews.title: Very Pleased

reviews.text: I have stayed there several times while receiving treatment at the University Cancer Center. Their rooms have been clean and comfortable with refrigerator, stove and microwave. They have friendly staff that remember me each time I stay. They shuttle me from DIA to the hotel and then to the University.
reviews.title: Good for the money.

reviews.text: There are few 3-star hotels for under $100/night near the Denver airport. The Timbers fits the bill nicely. Rooms and lobby are clean and simply furnished. Beds are very comfortable. The attached bar and grill has a good menu and friendly service. The included breakfast has a limited menu, but omelettes are made to order. Location is about 20 minutes from the airport, with nothing else nearby. Warning: shuttle only runs once an hour. A good enough hotel at a very good price.
reviews.title: Better than expected!

reviews.text: 21.f. A friend and I stayed in a king suite for a night while passing through. About 15 minute drive to downtown Denver! Impressed with the room for the price ranges. Is pretty quiet at night. So if you're looking for an affordable, quiet, and nice place to stay right outside of downtown, I would recommend!
reviews.title: Forget the Shuttle!!

reviews.text: This hotel was an excellent place to stay. The room was cleaned daily, the bed was comfortable. I made use of the fitness suite and was very impressed with the facilities in there too.
reviews.title: Excellent place to stay, clean and friendly

reviews.text: The attached bar/ restaurant served good food and a good selection on the breakfast menu.
reviews.title: The Timbers was great

reviews.text: So to summarise "Excellent".
reviews.title: Very disappointing!!! Consider staying elsewhere!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Timbers in Denver for a week while in town for softball. The kitchen in our room was great and had pots, pans, plates, bowls and silverware. We were able to save some money by cooking at the hotel.
reviews.title: Would have stayed longer given the chance!

reviews.text: The staff were very nice and helpful.
reviews.title: Do not be fooled by the website photos
